questions.question_text:
Examine this query:


SELECT * FROM bricks, colors -

Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
Answers are C and E.

choices.C: You can add a WHERE clause with filtering criteria.
choices.D: It returns the number of rows in bricks plus the number of rows in COLORS.
choices.E: It returns the same rows as SELECT * FROM bricks CROSS JOIN colors;.
choices.A: You can add a USING clause with a join condition.
choices.B: You can add an ON clause with a join condition.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A. It is used to specify an equijoin of columns that have the same name in both tables.
C. It can never be used with a natural join.

Selected Answer: AC
CORRECT ANS IS A,C.

choices.C: It can never be used with a natural join.
choices.E: It is used to specify an explicit join condition involving operators.
choices.D: All column names in a USING clause must be qualified with a table name or table alias.
choices.B: It can never be used with a full outer join.
choices.A: It is used to specify an equijoin of columns that have the same name in both tables.

questions.question_text: Which two are true about the USING clause when joining tables? (Choose two.)

Which two statements are true about date/time functions in a session where

NLS_DATE_FORMAT is set to DD-MON-YYYY HH24:MI:SS? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
ANS IS C D E, CAUSE, CURRECT TIME STAMP IS INCULDED WITH CURRENT DATA WHICH BASED ON THE SECESSION TIME.

choices.A: SYSDATE can be queried only from the dual table.
choices.E: CURRENT_TIMESTAMP returns the same date and time as SYSDATE with additional details of fractional seconds.
choices.F: SYSDATE and CURRENT__DATE return the current date and time set for the operating system of the database server.
choices.D: CURRENT_TIMESTAMP returns the same date as CURRENT_DATE.
choices.C: CURRENT_DATE returns the current date and time as per the session time zone.
choices.B: SYSDATE can be used in expressions only if the default date format is DD-MON-RR.

questions.question_text: Which three are true about the CREATE TABLE command? (Choose three.)

choices.D: It implicitly rolls back any pending transactions.
choices.A: It can include the CREATE..INDEX statement for creating an index to enforce the primary key constraint.
choices.F: The owner of the table must have the UNLIMITED TABLESPACE system privilege.
choices.B: The owner of the table should have space quota available on the tablespace where the table is defined.
choices.E: A user must have the CREATE ANY TABLE privilege to create tables.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
B, C and E are correct.

choices.A: ALTER TABLE products DROP COLUMN expiry_date;
choices.E: ALTER TABLE products DROP UNUSED COLUMNS;

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
WE CAN DROP THE UNUSED COLUMNS SINCE IT DOESNOT CHANGE THE STRUCTURE THE DATA STRUCTURE

Selected Answer: CDE
Since the columns are already set as unused u can drop them. 
U cant set the columns to unused for a read only table

questions.question_text:
Examine this description of the PRODUCTS table:

//IMG//


Rows exist in this table with data in all the columns. You put the PRODUCTS table in read-only mode.

Which three commands execute successfully on PRODUCTS? (Choose three.)
